name: Hackney Marshes
description: Council-administered park with 82 football  rugby & cricket pitches  changing rooms & a cafe.

name: Plashet Park
description: Community park with areas for cricket  soccer & basketball games  plus gardening & kids' workshops.

name: Bartlett Park
description: A tranquil experience  beautiful meadow flowers decorating the park  the flowers calm anyone who sits down amongst them  with flowers like anything from large Daiseys to poppies to name a few   just beautiful and very natural looking too  great for the insect wildlife  especially the bee's we need to look after the bee's.

name: St Paul's Park
description: Small park space with a climbing frame and some outdoor exercise equipment. Seating available. Could do with more play equipment for children. It's ok but could be more inviting.

name: Southwark Park
description: Public park opened in 1869  encompassing a bowling green  cafe  boating lake and bandstand.

name: Ravenscroft Park
description: Ravenscroft Park  Tower Hamlets. Address is :- 32-42 Ravenscroft St  Bethnal Green  London E2 8LT. Closed to London famous flowers market  its called Columbia flower market. A small park surrounded by high rise flats.

name: Shandy Park
description: Good space. There monkey bars and football court. There are other playing areas. There is  also an outdoor gym. Seating available. Big and spacious.

name: West Ham Park
description: Green space with paddling pool  playground  numerous sports facilities and wildflower meadows.

name: Radnor Park
description: It's a nice place for kids the play area has a rope climbing frame  a basket swing  swings for older and younger children  roundabout  a slide(which was added during lockdown and in my opinion could be made safer) and bouncy balance circles(which were also added during lockdown). There is a section that is yet to be completed I think work was stopped due to the covid-19 pandemic.

name: Beckton Park
description: Good green place to play football  running and for a quiet meditation.

name: Mayflower Park
description: Loved it. It's a big  open Green space that's used by local residents for a variety of purposes. The Illuminate Rotherhithe celebration of the voyage of the Mayflower to the US 400 years ago has a parade in November which always starts here - of course! And it was another wonderful evening where the local community gathered  picked up lanterns for the parade through the Rotherhithe neighborhood  and set off for St Peter's church. Highly recommended.

name: Nuttall Park
description: This is a lovely small park  hidden from busy Kingsland Road and Hoxton Street  between the buildings in Whitmore Estate. It has access to two children's playgrounds. In general  this is a silent and nice place to spend the afternoon hours.

name: Priory Park
description: Often full of rubbish  especially in the children area. Beware of chicken bones if you are walking your dog.

name: Shoreditch Park
description: Massive granite boulder forming a public-realm sculpture but also available to rock-climbers.

name: Hoxton Square Park
description: What a lovely place  clean and safe. There were a few bars around too doing takeout  but we didn't try them  just chilled out in the sunshine watching the world go by and seeing all the Happy people meeting each other and walking their dogs.

name: Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park
description: Bridges  wild land and play parks weave a latticework around London's 2012 Olympic venues.

name: Guy Street Park
description: Small urban park with lawned areas  a playground  sports court & view of The Shard.

name: Jubilee Park
description: Picturesque urban park over a Tube station offering landscaped lawns  water features & paths.

name: Dickens Square Park
description: Nice small green with children play area  body weight exercise equipment etc

name: Victory Community Park
description: Awesome loads of activities Nice quieter well maintained  basquetball  football pitch outdoor table tennis park for the children and friendly dog walkers

name: Nelson Square Park
description: Park featuring a playground & gardens  plus outdoor fitness equipment & a small football pitch.
